column3: ~~ACK fcb76edd9e2bbf788218ec5d88499e1464ebe9dc: nice to get rid of two functions and 14 LOC~~  Invalidating due to locale dependence.\n\nGood catch and nice first-time contribution @ahook. Hope to see more contributions from you! :)
ACK fcb76ed: We should be modernizing our code, I would say moving to to_string is a smart idea.
Concept ACK, there's one thing I *have* to ask though: is the output of `std::to_string` locale dependent in any way?

It looks like `std::to_string` is locale-dependent.\n\nReasoning: https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/string/basic_string/to_string claims it is equivalent to `std::sprintf` with the appropriate formatting string. `std:sprintf` behaves identical to C `sprintf`, which is locale-dependent.

Yes, unfortunately it seems `std::to_string` is locale dependent:

> `std::to_string` relies on the current locale for formatting purposes, [â€¦]. C++17 provides `std::to_chars` as a higher-performance locale-independent alternative.

:(
Ah nuts. Guess that's a dealbreaker? I'll close this out then.
We might switch to C++17, so maybe revisit then?\n\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16684#issuecomment-563126054
Closing as something we can revisit in the future. Commenters here can follow up with `std::to_string` usage in #17866.
